alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 1:36PM EST until January 14 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 215 PM EST. * At 135 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Nassau, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Chatham, Nassau, Adams, Cheshire, Stephentown, New Lebanon, Valatie, Kinderhook, Hancock, New Ashford, Averill Park, Lanesborough, Canaan, Richmond, East Nassau, Barkerville, Soldiers Memorial Field, West Stephentown, and Jacks Corners. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
